Rasam powder : South Indian recipe Freshly homemade recipes are always refreshing, delicious and healthy. Rasam Powder is a spice mix made with peculiar ingredients which makes the recipe more Â pungent flavor and a must try South Indian recipe. Itâ€™s my momâ€™s recipe and I hope you all love it ğŸ˜ Letâ€™s start with Ingredients and Procedure Quantity : 170 gms (~ approx ) Duration: 10 minutes Ingredients:
  • Curry leaves- fresh - 2 cups
  • Coriander seeds - 1 cup
  • Cumin seeds - 1 Tb sp
  • Pepper corns - Black - 1 Tb sp
  • Methi/ Fenugreek seeds - 1/2 Tb sp
  • Marati moggu / Kapok buds - 1 small piece
  • Stone flower/ Rati puvvu (herb) - 1 inch piece
  • Kashmiri Dry Red chillies - 25 ( you can also use regular dry Red chillies to make more spicy )
  • Cooking Oil - 1 Tb sp
Procedure:
  • Heat a nonstick pan over medium heat
  • Add oil, cumin seeds, coriander seeds, Fenugreek seeds, Pepper corns, Marathi moggu and stone flower
  • Saute a minute or so and add Kashmiri dry Red chillies and curry leaves
  • Saute few more minutes to make sure everything roasted evenly, probably it takes 5 minutes
  • Turn off heat and transfer roasted ingredients to a plate. Let it cool down
  • Add the roasted ingredients in a mixer grinder and make a coarse powder
  • Right now, each corner of my home is filled with fresh aromatic spice powder. It is Rasam Powder ğŸ˜Š
  • Try this super easy recipe and enjoy making piping hot Rasam with this spice powder
